title: Privacy controls in HR Service Management
content:
Aviator workflow business rules can automatically analyze whether Requests contain private information, including:

  • Personally identifiable information (such as names and contact details)
  • Financial information (such as credit card numbers and bank account details)
  • Health information (such as medical records and health insurance information)
  • Other sensitive information (such as authentication credentials and confidential business information).

The result of the privacy analysis and a short justification are displayed in the Request record together. If Aviator determines that a Request does include personal private information, the Request is automatically assigned to the "HR Private Sensitive" group. 

Enable privacy control in HR Service Management 

To use the automatic assignment feature of privacy analysis, perform the following steps.

Enable Aviator

For details, see Configure Aviator.

Add a functional group

In the agent interface, click Administration > Master Data > People > Groups, and then click New to add the group described below.

For more information, see Groups.

Use case Record type Field information
Privacy analysis for Requests Request

Name: HR Private Sensitive 

User principal name: HRPrivateSensitive 

Group type: Functional 

Email: none

Owner: none

Then, configure the "HR Private Sensitive" group to contain the appropriate users. 

Add business rules 

In the main menu, click Administration > Studio > Processes and Rules. In the record type drop-down list, select Request, and then add the required business rule.

Event Rule Action required in Studio
After change

Assign request to the "HR Private Sensitive" group when request contains sensitive or private information 

If If ${entity.Privacy!= null && indexof(to_lower_case(trim(entity.Privacy)), 'private') >=0 && tenant_settings.OT_AI_ENABLED == true && tenant_settings.AVIATOR_BUSINESS_RULE_ENABLED == true }

Set AssignedToGroup: HR Private Sensitive  

Add manually by using the Set fields template. 

Make sure you have already created the HR Private Sensitive functional group.
Rendering forms Hide the field "Privacy" if AI is disabled
If ${ !tenant_settings.OT_AI_ENABLED || !tenant_settings.AVIATOR_BUSINESS_RULE_ENABLED }
Hide Privacy		 Add manually by using the Hide fields template. 

Additional steps if upgraded from a version earlier than 24.4

If your environment is upgraded from a version earlier than 24.4, perform the following additional steps:

Update forms

In the main menu, click Administration > Studio > Forms. Select Request in the record type drop-down list, and then update the below forms as described.

Form Section Field to add Suggested position
Preview Request form Request details Privacy After the Urgency field
Full Request form Categorization Privacy After the Urgency field
Without Resolution form Classification Privacy After the Urgency field
Without Resolution form Assignement Assignement group After the Service desk group field
Add business rules 

In the main menu, click Administration > Studio > Processes and Rules. In the record type drop-down list, select Request, and then add the required business rules.

Event Rule Action required in Studio
After applying changes

AVIATOR: Determine if the request includes personal private data 

If ${current_update.Description.IsChanged || count(comments_filtered(comments_added(current_update.Comments.OldValue, current_update.Comments.NewValue), 'CommentFrom', 'User'))>0 }

Set Privacy by calling Aviator based on Privacy and Description, Comments using Analyze privacy 

 Add using comparison mode
